posts.post_content: Actually, I could see him being very useful today with the Proliferate mechanism. He's the only card I've seen that gets +2/+2 counters; just get him to kill someone, proliferate twice ([Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine)), and you've got a brand spankin' new 11/11 flyer.

Posted By: Aburaishi (2/10/2011 7:43:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I love this guy.  
One of my first Legends, still one of my favourites.  
Double old vampire, and a nice little tribal ability (admittedily, vampire wasn't really tribal 'til recently).  
  
And check out that outfit. Now *that* is what vampire legends should look like.  
  
As it has been noted, his drawback, 8cmc, is really just a suggestion, one very rarely followed, except as a laugh.  
  
I love him, as should everyone (though I think it will take some convincing to get [Ihsan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ihsan) to do so...)  
  
4.5/5

Posted By: DarthParallax (3/9/2012 10:58:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In the image released with the name of the next block **Innnistrad**, it looks like [Irini Sengir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Irini Sengir) is on a throne gloating while this guy is seriously hurt on the floor to the left. Combine the picture, the tagline 'Horror lurks within', and the fact that we have had cards such as [barony vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=barony vampire) and [vampire aristocrat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vampire aristocrat) that specifically talk about Baron sengirs realm, I would say we are returning to the homelands plotline. Now that vampire is black's tribal, we should see a lot of interactions there as the Sengirs finally lead their armies out of the dwarven portal to who knows where. I'm curious if Wizards can make up for what is popularly considered one of the worst blocks ever, even worse than kamigawa. I certainly hope so, this will be interesting.  
  
  
A link for those who are curious: http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/arcana/666  
  
EDIT: well, i guess not, but there's always the future, althoug... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Now that vampire is black's tribal, we should see a lot of interactions there as the Sengirs finally lead their armies out of the dwarven portal to who knows where. I'm curious if Wizards can make up for what is popularly considered one of the worst blocks ever, even worse than kamigawa. I certainly hope so, this will be interesting.
